page.title: 12SCIENCE AT WHARLEYCROFT
page.content: The former gamekeepers cottage is now a UMIST field study centre.Besides accommodation for a research team working on nearby Great Dun Fell,there are weather measuring devices whose readings at 200m complement those made on the high station.Research is into cloud formation & atmospheric chemist- ry.The information gained enables scientists to study the effect of pollutants in the atmosphere.Because "acid rain" is now a matter of inter- national concern,this is now one of a network of research sites being used by different groups to investigate the effect of gases on clouds & rain.The question is so complex that the work has years still to go,but it is encouraging that so many organisations take part,from the Atomic Energy Authority & CEGB to the Met.Office & Institute of Terrestrial Ecology.
